instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2610: What is 820-2610? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board not turning on green light
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 2009 macbook 17" 2009,  no liquid damage,  green light , not turning on , 8.41v=<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, what to do what to do 

it was turning on 2 days  ago , any GPU issue ? or gpu caps ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board not turning on green light
threads.message: Shorting power pads to turn it on? Replaced <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board not turning on green light
threads.message: Shorting power pads does not turn on , <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> didnt chk yet, why ppbus 8.41v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board not turning on green light
threads.message: I'm guessing 8.4 volts because that's what some of the older boards run on. If you're sure there's no liquid near the SMC or on the board, nothing to worry about then. I'd say see what voltage you get on <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> when you short the power pads.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board not turning on green light
threads.message: Oh and using known good 85 watt?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board not turning on green light
threads.message: UPDATE, EXTERNAL 12.6V ON FUSE  BOARD WORKS, so isl no good ?  it producing 8.41v?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board not turning on green light
threads.message: My bad for that I just realized this is a pro forgive me my brain is scrambled. Let's start over, using known good Magsafe 1 85 watt? Voltage on pin 1 and two of the fuse?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board not turning on green light
threads.message: First check voltage on <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>, if not 1.1V replace <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>.
